diseases.name: Tomato Early Blight
diseases.description: Early blight is a common fungal disease that affects tomato plants, causing dark spots on leaves and reducing yield. It typically appears during warm, humid conditions.
symptoms: Dark brown spots with concentric rings on lower leaves
Leaf drop starting from bottom of plant
Stem lesions with dark brown color
treatments: Remove and destroy infected leaves immediately
Apply fungicide containing chlorothalonil or copper
Use neem oil as organic alternative (spray weekly)
Ensure proper spacing between plants for air circulation
Water at base of plant, avoid wetting leaves
Apply mulch to prevent soil splash on leaves
prevention: Stake or cage plants to improve air flow
Apply preventive fungicide in humid conditions
Maintain proper plant nutrition with balanced fertilizer

diseases.name: Tomato Late Blight
diseases.description: Late blight is a devastating disease that can destroy entire tomato crops within days. It's the same pathogen that caused the Irish Potato Famine.
symptoms: Large brown or black patches on leaves
White fuzzy growth on leaf undersides
Hard brown spots on green fruits
Rapid plant collapse in severe cases
causes: High humidity and prolonged leaf wetness
treatments: Remove and destroy infected plants immediately
Apply copper-based fungicide at first signs
prevention: Apply preventive fungicide before symptoms appear
Monitor weather for favorable disease conditions

diseases.name: Tomato Leaf Mold
diseases.description: Leaf mold is a fungal disease that primarily affects greenhouse tomatoes. It causes yellowing and browning of leaves, reducing photosynthesis.
symptoms: Pale green or yellow spots on upper leaf surface
Olive-green to brown fuzzy growth on leaf undersides
treatments: Remove affected leaves and destroy them
Use fans to improve air circulation
Lower humidity with heating and venting
prevention: Use drip irrigation instead of overhead

diseases.name: Tomato Septoria Leaf Spot
diseases.description: Septoria leaf spot is one of the most destructive tomato diseases. It causes rapid defoliation and can significantly reduce yields.
symptoms: Small circular spots with dark borders
Gray or tan centers with tiny black dots
treatments: Use chlorothalonil fungicide for severe cases
Mulch around plants to prevent soil splash
Water at base of plants only
prevention: Remove all plant debris after harvest

diseases.name: Tomato Bacterial Spot
diseases.description: Bacterial spot is a serious disease affecting tomatoes and peppers. It causes leaf spots and fruit lesions, reducing marketability.
symptoms: Small dark brown to black spots on leaves
treatments: Use streptomycin if available and legal

diseases.name: Potato Early Blight
diseases.description: Early blight affects potato plants causing leaf spots and tuber damage. It's most severe in warm, humid conditions.
symptoms: Brown spots with target-like rings on leaves
causes: Plant stress from drought or poor nutrition
prevention: Hill soil around plants to protect tubers

diseases.name: Potato Late Blight
diseases.description: The most destructive potato disease, capable of destroying entire fields. Requires immediate action when detected.
symptoms: White fuzzy growth on leaf undersides
Brown to black lesions on stems
treatments: Cut and remove foliage before harvest
Allow tubers to cure 2-3 weeks before harvest
prevention: Destroy cull piles and volunteer plants

diseases.name: Corn Common Rust
diseases.description: Common rust is a widespread corn disease that causes reddish-brown pustules on leaves, reducing photosynthesis and yield.
symptoms: Pustules on both sides of leaves
Premature leaf death in severe cases
treatments: Scout fields regularly for early detection
Apply fungicide at first sign of disease
No treatment needed for resistant varieties

diseases.name: Corn Northern Leaf Blight
diseases.description: Northern leaf blight causes long, narrow lesions on corn leaves. It can significantly reduce yields in susceptible hybrids.
symptoms: Entire leaves may die in severe cases
Reduced ear fill and grain quality
causes: High humidity and extended leaf wetness
treatments: Apply fungicide at early symptom stage
Apply second application if disease progresses
Time applications based on growth stage
Consider aerial application for large fields
prevention: Bury or shred corn residue after harvest
Plant at optimal dates for region

diseases.name: Wheat Leaf Rust
diseases.description: Leaf rust is the most common rust disease of wheat worldwide. It can cause significant yield losses if left unmanaged.
symptoms: Pustules mostly on upper leaf surface
treatments: Use tank mixes for better control
prevention: Plant at recommended time for region

diseases.name: Grape Black Rot
diseases.description: Black rot is one of the most serious diseases of grapes in humid regions. It can destroy entire grape clusters.
symptoms: Black pycnidia (dots) in center of spots
Fruit shrivels into hard black mummies
causes: Rain and splash dispersal of spores
treatments: Spray every 7-14 days during wet periods
prevention: Remove all mummified berries from vineyard
Start fungicide program at bud break

diseases.name: Apple Scab
diseases.description: Apple scab is the most serious disease of apple trees. It affects leaves, fruit, and young shoots, reducing quality and yield.
symptoms: Olive-green to brown spots on leaves
causes: Infected leaves on ground from previous year
Spring rain during green tip to petal fall
treatments: Begin sprays at green tip stage
Apply every 7-10 days until petal fall
Extend interval to 10-14 days after petal fall
Ensure complete coverage of leaves and fruit
Use tank mixes for resistance management
prevention: Rake and destroy fallen leaves in autumn
Prune trees for good air circulation
Apply urea to fallen leaves to speed decay
Maintain regular fungicide schedule in spring
